title: [K-12] Physical Education Environment Design Project Through Open Space Exploration

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational physical education theory and project-based learning experience
context.additional_context: Learners acquire mathematical modeling and spatial analysis techniques required for designing physical education environments for middle-aged and older adults, and strengthen practical skills through real-world project applications. This includes data collection and environmental simulation using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can propose strategies to optimize learner-environment interactions by applying ecological dynamics principles when designing open-air physical education spaces.
Learners can mathematically model and analyze the physical education space design process, considering political, cultural, and historical factors.
Learners can design practical physical education environments by referencing similar cases such as Skills Garden and PLAYCE, developed using the PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.

resources: Physical Space Design Tool (3D Modeling Software)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
